history.content:
I have been hearing from a few students who are confused or concerned about being on the wait list for EECS classes now that the add/drop deadline has passed.

Please be aware that we often do not purge wait lists when the add/drop deadline passes because no further action will be taken with the wait list. You will not be enrolled into the class after the add/drop deadline without completing the LATE CHANGES form that requires multiple signatures for approval. 

One reason we don't purge the wait lists is because we need to know for future reference how many students weren't able to enroll into a class by the cutoff. If we purge the wait lists, we lose that information that we use for planning purposes.

While it may show that you are wait listed for the class in CalCentral, those units DO NOT count toward your overall unit limit for the semester. You will only be given units for classes in which you are actually ENROLLED. You do not need to 'drop' from a wait list - remaining on the wait list actually has no impact to you once the add/drop deadline passes.
